content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction x cubed, over 3, end fraction, minus the fraction x squared, over 2, end fraction minus 6 x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. On which open intervals is <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> decreasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="negative 2 is less than x, which is less than 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> only

<math alttext="x is less than negative 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x is greater than 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="x is less than one half " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> only

content.answer: <math alttext="negative 2 is less than x, which is less than 3 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> only

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
